key_points.text:
Positive Sentiment:
Second-quarter EPS of $4.08 topped forecasts by $0.22, while revenue of $17.86 billion beat estimates and marked 9.3% year-over-year growth.

American Express surpasses profit expectations on robust spending
Positive Sentiment:
Q2 earnings climbed 17% year-over-year, driven by premium cardholders and higher fees, underscoring resilient revenue streams despite rising costs.
American Express Q2 Earnings Beat Estimates on Premium Customers
P

American Express Company (AXP) shares are trading higher following stronger-than-expected second-quarter results and upbeat management commentary, although travel-spending headwinds and a neutral analyst downgrade have capped gains.

Markets Await Consumer Sentiment Reading
Negative Sentiment:
Shares dipped 3.3% amid profit-taking and a “Time to Sell?” narrative questioning further upside.
American Express (NYSE:AXP) Stock Price Down 3.3% - Time to Sell?
Negative Sentiment:
Monness Crespi & Hardt downgraded AXP shares to “Neutral,” pointing to valuation concerns and broader industry uncertainty.
